text: Bransbury Common is a biological Site of Special Scientific Interest south- east of Andover in Hampshire. It is a Nature Conservation Review site, Grade I. This site has two different habitats. The soil of the common is peat over gravel, and the dominant plants are purple moor-grass and greater tussock- sedge. There is also a former water meadow, which has flowering plants including lady's smock, marsh marigold and early marsh-orchid. ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Hampshire Category:Nature Conservation Review sites
title: Bransbury Common
